thread.title: 18 Absolutely Ridiculous Ways People Reacted To A Cyclone Debbie
thread.title_full: 18 Absolutely Ridiculous Ways People Reacted To A Cyclone Debbie - BuzzFeed News

author: Brad Esposito
title: 18 Absolutely Ridiculous Ways People Reacted To A Cyclone Debbie
text:
View this image ‚Ä∫ 
Seven Network ID: 10781428 2. Here‚Äôs a bunch of ‚Äòem, all wet and flustered from the ridiculous wind speeds and crazy sideways rain. View this image ‚Ä∫ 
Seven Network ID: 10781463 The former mayor of Bowen Shire Mike Brunker criticised the journalists for acting against the advice of emergency services. He called one a ‚Äúgoose‚Äù. View this image ‚Ä∫ 
Channel 9 ID: 10781466 3. Some locals tried their hand at weather reporting as well ‚Äì and did a pretty good job! Loading View on Instagram 
Instagram: @stevemeyer7 ID: 10781286 4. This punter was interviewed at a bar and took the opportunity to make a blowjob joke on national television (thank god someone did). One chance on TV... its your moment mate, make your family, friends and town proud... üòûüòûüò±üò± #CycloneDebbie
‚Äî Chris White (@ytboy7) ID: 10781271 5. These happy folk boarded up their house and then decorated. Loading View on Instagram 
Instagram: @bondstreetblue_ ID: 10781274 6. On Monday, before Debbie made landfall, a pair of kangaroos boxed on the beach. Hope these boxing #kanagaroos at #CapeHillsborough bunker down. #CycloneDebbie is set to cross between there and Ay‚Ä¶ https://t.co/gdcz3EUCh7
‚Äî Lisa Herbert (@MsLisaHerbert) ID: 10781275 7. There was an abundance of trampolines flying through the sky, ending up broken‚Ä¶ Facebook Post . Facebook: 9NewsPerth ID: 10781283 8. Or stranded in a field. Loading View on Instagram 
Instagram: @owlhouseink ID: 10781277 9. NASA released some seriously cool footage of Cyclone Debbie from space. Facebook: video.php ID: 10781285 10. People quickly began to doubt the authenticity of the footage. @ABCNews24 @Space_Station @NASA nothing about this even looks remotely real. the shadow, the cloud cover, the speed ... its all fake.
‚Äî Vermont4TRUMP (@Vermonts4Trump) ID: 10781356 Some of the theories revolved around the Earth being flat, while others said the NASA imagery was nothing more than CGI. @ABCNews24 @Space_Station @NASA #fakenews nice CGI. we all know the earth is flat and this is garbage. nice try.
‚Äî Vermont4TRUMP (@Vermonts4Trump) ID: 10781357 flat earthers think NASA is creating computer-generated images of Cyclone Debbie
‚Äî brad esposito (@braddybb) ID: 10781362 11. A few boats were cut loose and went for an impromptu sail on the ocean. Loading View on Instagram 
Instagram: @thetodayshow ID: 10781287 12. And ~arty~ types wrapped local installations in bubblewrap for protection. View this image ‚Ä∫ 
Ian Hitchcock / Getty Images ID: 10781350 13. Someone wrote: ‚ÄúCyclone Debbie Bring It On, Bowen Is Not A Pussy Town, Do Your Best You Got.‚Äù If the fence survives, the message will live on‚Ä¶ Loading View on Instagram 
Instagram: @louise__fish ID: 10781290 14. Couples who had chosen the weekend to go on holiday were left in very exotic locations with a very intense and slightly terrifying ambience. Loading View on Instagram 
Instagram: @amilekabyronbay ID: 10781377 15. And then there are locals like Keith Hills, who is sitting out the cyclone in his caravan. Keith.... do not do this.
‚Äî brad esposito (@braddybb) ‚ÄúIf it‚Äôs gonna kill me, I‚Äôm meant to go that way,‚Äù he said.
Via news.com.au ID: 10781387 16. While this dude chose to ride it out in an old school bus filled with snakes. Wonderful. Man plans to ride out Cyclone Debbie in a bus with his snakes https://t.co/ZO9HiZSfkG
‚Äî Brisbane Times (@brisbanetimes) ID: 10781390 17. A daredevil kite surfer took the opportunity to get in one last surf before the storm really hit. Which is probably not advised. A kite surfer in Bowen has been capture surfing the winds of Tropical Cyclone Debbie. #7News
‚Äî 7 News Queensland (@7NewsQueensland) ID: 10781401 18. And memes, of course, were made. Facebook Post . facebook.com ID: 10781403 The eye of the cyclone has just reached the coastline of north Queensland and 30,000 people are so far without power. The Bureau of Meteorology says destructive winds are no longer expected in many of the major towns ‚Äì so really it‚Äôs just gonna be really, really, wet. Be careful out there! View this image ‚Ä∫ 
FOX ID: 10781493 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com! 
Brad Esposito is a news reporter for BuzzFeed and is based in Sydney, Australia. Contact Brad Esposito at bradley.esposito@buzzfeed.com . Got a confidential tip? Submit it here .
